techmeme.title: Judge overseeing hearing on fixing Google's monopoly questioned if DOJ's proposal to force a sale of Chrome met the "causation" standard for a structural remedy (Erin Woo/The Information)
Airbnb now shows the full cost of a stay, excluding taxes, in search results by default; a Biden-era FTC rule on "junk fees" is set to go into effect on May 12 (Natalie Lung/Bloomberg)
After Meta blocked news on its platforms in Canada, misleading content from right-wing pages like Canada Proud filled the gap ahead of the federal election (New York Times)
Google settles an Android TV case with India's competition regulator, will offer standalone licenses for Play Store and Play Services for Android TVs in India (NDTV)
The US FTC sues Uber, claiming the company charged for Uber One without consent, made it difficult to cancel, and failed to deliver promised savings (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
